text:
In early 2014, Google acquired a London based startup called DeepMind. The price was over $500M. For a company that had no products, customers, or revenue, the acquisition was a contrarian move. But behind the scenes, DeepMind had been building a team of over 100 PhD AI researchers all aimed at “Solving Intelligence”.

Led by Demis Hassabis, a child chess prodigy turned game designer turned neuroscientist, DeepMind, is working on a core intelligence platform that could serve as the platform upon which Artificial General Intelligence (think “Her”) could be delivered.

DeepMind’s efforts exist at a level of sophistication that few other firms are operating at today. Only independent firms Numenta and Vicarious (and Metamind, recently acquired by Salesforce) appear to be taking a similar “Manhattan Project” style approach. With Google’s unlimited deep pockets behind Hassabis and team, they are the odds on favorites to first create an robot consciousness. Alphabet [GOOGL] holds the #1 position in our AI Winners portfolio.

Hassabis was filmed at at Google Zeitgeist presentation in 2015. The talk is quite revealing.
title: The Theory of Everything with Google’s Demis Hassabias
